field.name: summary
field.value: Unable to resolve parent components when a dependency is only registered in a child container

field.name: description
field.value:
The following scenario should work but doesn't: Register IParent + implementation in parent container. IParent impl depends on IChild. Register IChild + implementation in child container. Resolve IParent via child container. Expected that IChild dependency is satisfied by child container, but getting a handler exception: Castle.MicroKernel.Handlers.HandlerException: Can't create component 'Parent' as it has dependencies to be satisfied. Parent is waiting for the following dependencies: Services: - IChild which was not registered.
Originally reported via Castle Users Mailing List: http://groups.google.com/group/castle-project-users/browse_thread/thread/7da83d066ecf4664
Unit test to reproduce bug is available at http://gist.github.com/395377. ResolveComplexServiceRegisteredInParentWithDependenciesRegisteredInChild() fails.

comment.author: xtoff
comment.text:
Fixed (or rather worked around).
The fix is hacky - I don't like it. We should come up with something better.
